burst_limit.description: Helm burst limit. Increase this if you have a cluster with many CRDs

debug.description: Debug indicates whether or not Helm is running in Debug mode.

manifest.description: Enable full diff by storing the rendered manifest in the state.

helm_driver.description: The backend storage driver. Values are: configmap, secret, memory, sql

client_certificate.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for TLS authentication.

client_key.description: PEM-encoded client certificate key for TLS authentication.

cluster_ca_certificate.description: PEM-encoded root certificates bundle for TLS authentication.

config_context.description: Context to choose from the config file. Can be sourced from KUBE_CTX.

config_context_auth_info.description: Authentication info context of the kube config (name of the kubeconfig user, --user flag in kubectl). Can be sourced from KUBE_CTX_AUTH_INFO.

config_context_cluster.description: Cluster context of the kube config (name of the kubeconfig cluster, --cluster flag in kubectl). Can be sourced from KUBE_CTX_CLUSTER.

config_path.description: Path to the kube config file. Can be set with KUBE_CONFIG_PATH.

config_paths.description: A list of paths to kube config files. Can be set with KUBE_CONFIG_PATHS environment variable.

api_version.description: API version for the exec plugin.

command.description: Command to run for Kubernetes exec plugin

env.description: Environment variables for the exec plugin

host.description: The hostname (in form of URI) of kubernetes master

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate.

password.description: The password to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes master endpoint.

proxy_url.description: URL to the proxy to be used for all API requests.

tls_server_name.description: Server name passed to the server for SNI and is used in the client to check server certificates against.

token.description: Token to authenticate a service account.

username.description: The username to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes master endpoint

plugins_path.description: The path to the helm plugins directory

qps.description: Queries per second used when communicating with the Kubernetes API. Can be used to avoid throttling.

password.description: The password to use for the OCI HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes master endpoint.

url.description: OCI URL in form of oci://host:port or oci://host

username.description: The username to use for the OCI HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes master endpoint.

registry_config_path.description: The path to the registry config file

repository_cache.description: The path to the file containing cached repository indexes

repository_config_path.description: The path to the file containing repository names and URLs

block.description: Schema to define attributes that are available in the provider

atomic.description: If set, installation process purges chart on fail. The wait flag will be set automatically if atomic is used

chart.description: Chart name to be installed. A path may be used

cleanup_on_fail.description: Allow deletion of new resources created in this upgrade when upgrade fails

create_namespace.description: Create the namespace if it does not exist

dependency_update.description: Run helm dependency update before installing the chart

devel.description: Use chart development versions, too. Equivalent to version '>0.0.0-0'. If 'version' is set, this is ignored

disable_crd_hooks.description: Prevent CRD hooks from running, but run other hooks. See helm install --no-crd-hook

disable_openapi_validation.description: If set, the installation process will not validate rendered templates against the Kubernetes OpenAPI Schema

force_update.description: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed.

keyring.description: Location of public keys used for verification, Used only if 'verify is true'

max_history.description: Limit the maximum number of revisions saved per release. Use 0 for no limit

app_version.description: The version number of the application being deployed

first_deployed.description: FirstDeployed is an int64 which represents timestamp when the release was first deployed.

last_deployed.description: LastDeployed is an int64 which represents timestamp when the release was last deployed.

name.description: Name is the name of the release

namespace.description: Namespace is the kubernetes namespace of the release

notes.description: Notes is the description of the deployed release, rendered from templates.

revision.description: Version is an int32 which represents the version of the release

values.description: Set of extra values. added to the chart. The sensitive data is cloaked. JSON encoded.

version.description: A SemVer 2 conformant version string of the chart

name.description: Release name. The length must not be longer than 53 characters

namespace.description: Namespace to install the release into

args.description: An argument to the post-renderer (can specify multiple)

render_subchart_notes.description: If set, render subchart notes along with the parent

replace.description: Re-use the given name, even if that name is already used. This is unsafe in production

repository.description: Repository where to locate the requested chart. If it is a URL, the chart is installed without installing the repository

reset_values.description: When upgrading, reset the values to the ones built into the chart

resources.description: The kubernetes resources created by this release.

reuse_values.description: When upgrading, reuse the last release's values and merge in any overrides. If 'reset_values' is specified, this is ignored

set.description: Custom values to be merged with the values

set_list.description: Custom sensitive values to be merged with the values

set_sensitive.description: Custom sensitive values to be merged with the values

set_wo.description: Custom values to be merged with the values

set_wo_revision.description: The current revision of the write-only "set_wo" attribute. Incrementing this integer value will cause Terraform to update the write-only value.

skip_crds.description: If set, no CRDs will be installed. By default, CRDs are installed if not already present

take_ownership.description: If set, Helm will take ownership of resources not already annotated by this release. Useful for migrations or recovery.

timeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for any individual kubernetes operation

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

upgrade_install.description: If true, the provider will install the release at the specified version even if a release not controlled by the provider is present. This is equivalent to running 'helm upgrade --install'. WARNING: this may not be suitable for production use -- see the 'Upgrade Mode' note in the provider documentation. Defaults to `false`.

values.description: List of values in raw YAML format to pass to helm

verify.description: Verify the package before installing it.

version.description: Specify the exact chart version to install. If this is not specified, the latest version is installed

wait.description: Will wait until all resources are in a ready state before marking the release as successful.

wait_for_jobs.description: If wait is enabled, will wait until all Jobs have been completed before marking the release as successful.

block.description: Schema to define attributes that are available in the resource

api_versions.description: Kubernetes api versions used for Capabilities.APIVersions.

atomic.description: If set, the installation process purges the chart on fail. The 'wait' flag will be set automatically if 'atomic' is used.

chart.description: Chart name to be installed. A path may be used.

crds.description: List of rendered CRDs from the chart.

create_namespace.description: Create the namespace if it does not exist.

dependency_update.description: Run helm dependency update before installing the chart.

devel.description: Use chart development versions, too. Equivalent to version '>0.0.0-0'. If `version` is set, this is ignored.

disable_openapi_validation.description: If set, the installation process will not validate rendered templates against the Kubernetes OpenAPI Schema.

include_crds.description: Include CRDs in the templated output.

keyring.description: Location of public keys used for verification. Used only if `verify` is true.

manifest.description: Concatenated rendered chart templates. This corresponds to the output of the `helm template` command.

manifests.description: Map of rendered chart templates indexed by the template name.

namespace.description: Namespace to install the release into.

notes.description: Rendered notes if the chart contains a `NOTES.txt`.

args.description: An argument to the post-renderer (can specify multiple)

render_subchart_notes.description: If set, render subchart notes along with the parent.

replace.description: Re-use the given name, even if that name is already used. This is unsafe in production.

repository.description: Repository where to locate the requested chart. If it is a URL the chart is installed without installing the repository.

reset_values.description: When upgrading, reset the values to the ones built into the chart.

reuse_values.description: When upgrading, reuse the last release's values and merge in any overrides. If 'reset_values' is specified, this is ignored.

set.description: Custom values to be merged with the values

set_list.description: Custom sensitive values to be merged with the values

set_sensitive.description: Custom sensitive values to be merged with the values

set_wo.description: Write-only custom values to be merged with the values.

show_only.description: Only show manifests rendered from the given templates.

skip_crds.description: If set, no CRDs will be installed. By default, CRDs are installed if not already present.

skip_tests.description: If set, tests will not be rendered. By default, tests are rendered.

timeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

validate.description: Validate your manifests against the Kubernetes cluster you are currently pointing at. This is the same validation performed on an install.

values.description: List of values in raw yaml format to pass to helm.

verify.description: Verify the package before installing it.

version.description: Specify the exact chart version to install. If this is not specified, the latest version is installed.

wait.description: Will wait until all resources are in a ready state before marking the release as successful.

block.description: Data source to render Helm chart templates.
